Thanks for using and join us MemoryEase
Time Format
Aerobic exercise is particularly good for the brain, so choose activities that keep your blood pumping. In general, anything that is good for your heart is great for your brain. Does it take you a long time to clear out the sleep fog when you wake up? If so, you may find that exercising in the morning before you start your day makes a big difference. In addition to clearing away the cobwebs, it also primes you for learning throughout the day. Physical activities that require hand-eye coordination or complex motor skills are particularly beneficial for brain building. Exercise breaks can help you get past mental fatigue and afternoon slumps. Even a short walk or a few jumping jacks can be enough to reboot your brain.
The practice of meditation may positively affect your health in many ways. It is relaxing and soothing, and has been found to reduce stress and pain, lower blood pressure and even improve memory (8Trusted Source). In fact, meditation has been shown to increase gray matter in the brain. Gray matter contains neuron cell bodies. As you age, gray matter declines, which negatively impacts memory and cognition. Meditation and relaxation techniques have been shown to improve short-term memory in people of all ages, from people in their 20s to older adults. For example, one study showed that Taiwanese college students who engaged in meditation practices like mindfulness had significantly better spatial working memory than students who did not practice meditation. Spatial working memory is the ability to hold and process information in your mind about the positions of objects in space.
Lack of proper sleep has been associated with poor memory for quite some time. Sleep plays an important role in memory consolidation, a process in which short-term memories are strengthened and transformed into long-lasting memories. Research shows that if you’re sleep deprived, you could be negatively impacting your memory. For example, one study looked at the effects of sleep in 40 children between ages 10 and 14 years. One group of children was trained for memory tests in the evening, then tested the following morning after a night’s sleep. The other group was trained and tested on the same day, with no sleep between training and testing. The group that slept between training and testing performed 20% better on the memory tests. Another study found that nurses working the night shift made more mathematical errors and that 68% of them scored lower on memory tests compared with nurses working the day shift. Health experts recommend adults get between 7 and 9 hours of sleep each night for optimal health.
Meditation isn’t just good for your body it’s also good for your brain. Research suggests meditation may increase gray matter in the brain and improve spatial working memory. Exercise brings incredible benefits for your whole body, including your brain. Even moderate exercise for short periods has been shown to improve cognitive performance, including memory, across all age groups. Studies have consistently associated sufficient sleep with better memory performance. Sleep helps consolidate memories. You’re also likely to perform better on memory tests if you’re well rested than if you’re sleep deprived. Games that challenge your brain may help you strengthen your memory and may even reduce the risk of dementia.

have a question about the subscriptions, or want to request a new features?
Take a peek at our FAQ
for quick, answers, or fill out the form below and we all get back to you soon. We will not use it for evil (or anything other than writing you back.)
Various recommendations to prevent short and long term forgetfulness. Various puzzles and more. Access detailed statistics of the reminders you set weekly, monthly, yearly (how many reminders you set in which time intervals, in which categories, etc.) and much more Set unlimited reminders, customize reminder sound, icon and more. Ability to set reminders via widget without opening the app. Want your app to stay a certain color? we got you. Flip switch and keep it exactly how you like it We\'re a tiny indie developer entirely by our sweet customers. Your upgrade will help us continue to improve MemoryEase long into the future--thanks so much for your support! Go back up to upgrade
About the Team Hey Hi Hello! We\'re Hakan Ozcan and Mustafa Yildiz the crew behind MemoryEase. Here\'s the tale of how it came to be, and our philosophy for building it. In fact, we suffered from forgetfulness many times during the day. When we thought about how we could prevent this problem, we actually laid the foundations of MemoryEase. We thought we could do better by making something obvius: an app that showed only the most important info in one straightforward page. We looked at various apps, searched for advice, but nothing was enough We spent a long time testing, gathering information, getting advice from people who suffered from the same problem, and after a long development process, MemoryEase was born We launched version 1.0 for Android in late 2023.
A statistic of which day you set the most reminders. It can be an indicator of which days you might be more forgetful. A statistic on which time you set reminders the most. It can be an indicator of which hours you might be more forgetful.

Instructions 1. In Sudoku it is intended to place all the remaining pieces on the board. The numbers range from 1 to 9 (in 9x9 Sudoku). 2. The board is separated into several squares, and inside each of them it is only allowed to place one of each number. 3. It is only allowed to place one of each number at each row, both horizontal and vertical. Go back

Reminder Title Reminder Description SET LOCATION SET TIME Time: Date: Remind at certain intervals Select Category Click SET REMINDER
How to Set a Reminder?
by Time by Location
If you only want to set a reminder for a specific time, you need to select the time and date.(no need to select the location) If you want to remember to reach a specific location, just set a reminder by location (no need to select time and date). Reminder works when 1 km distance remains.
Remind me when I\'m within kilometers of the location.
How it works Feature Requests
Widgets Upgrades and Billings Canceling FAQs
How do I set an reminder by location? When you click on the Add reminder button on the main screen, you can select the address you want from the Location box. (You do not need to select time and date.)
When we set reminders, can we define\n our own category? Not at the moment. But if you let us know,\n we can add this feature. Can the app access or save any data on\n my phone? Absolutely not.
Will we be able to add our own voices to\n the reminders? Probably yes. When is the forum feature coming? Probably one or two releases later.
When I set a reminder by location, do I need to have the location turned on, on my device? Yes for now.
//Widgets Widget How do I add a home screen widget on my device? Press and hold any icon on your home screen until all icons go into "wiggle mode". You will then see a button called widgets on the home screen. Click on the widgets button and you will see MemoryEase among the options.
//Upgrade And Billing Upgrade and Billing If I pay to upgrade MemoryEase on my device. Can I use the paid version on my other device. You can definitely use it with your existing account. Can I share my MemoryEase subscription with other people in my family? Of course, but for now, doing so may cause the alarm to go off when you don\'t want it to.
// Subs Cancelling How do I cancel my subscription?

//Location What a reminder by location does? When you select a location you want to be reminded of,\nMemoryEase will remind you of the selected\nlocation when there is only 1 kilometer left to\nthe selected location. Of course, you need to have your location\nturned on in the background of your device.
Reminder by Location When you approach your chosen location,don\'t worry if you forget!\nMemoryEase will remind you.

https://play.google.com/store/account/subscriptions or E-mail Support.
A subscription is not required to use MemoryEase\'s basic features. Monthly subscriptions will be billed $0.99 per month until cancelled. Annual subscriptions will be $5.99 per year until cancelled. One time subscriptions will be billed $29.99 one time. You can cancel a monthly or annual subscription any time by following this link: https://play.google.com/store/account/subscriptions. Thank you for your support.

With the idea of imparting programming knowledge, Mr. Sandeep Jain, an IIT Roorkee alumnus started a dream, GeeksforGeeks. Whether programming excites you or you feel stifled, wondering how to prepare for interview questions or how to ace data structures and algorithms, GeeksforGeeks is a one-stop solution. With every tick of time, we are adding arrows in our quiver. From articles on various computer science subjects to programming problems for practice, from basic to premium courses, from technologies to entrance examinations, we have been building ample content with superior quality. In a short span, we have built a community of 1 Million+ Geeks around the world, 20,000+ Contributors and 500+ Campus Ambassadors in various colleges across the nation. Our success stories include a lot of students who benefitted in their placements and landed jobs at tech giants. Our vision is to build a gigantic network of geeks and we are only a fraction of it yet.

To reduce forgetfulness, drag the items\non your shopping list and put\nthem in the cart.Remember, you will only\nput the items on the list in the cart.\n3 Watch the time!
